content.question: The inner wire of a coaxial cable carries current <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math>. The radius of the inner wire is <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>, and the radius of the outer shield, in which there is no current, is <math alttext="b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi></math>. What is the magnitude of the magnetic flux through a square extending from the outer radius of the inner wire to the inner radius of the shield, as shown in the Side View?

choices.label: <math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, times I, times open parenthesis, b minus a, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 pi, end fraction, times the natural log of the fraction b over a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>Φ</mtext><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, times I, and denominator 2 pi a, end fraction, times open parenthesis, b minus a, close parenthesis, squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>Φ</mtext><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="phi sub B equals, mu sub 0, end sub, times I, times open parenthesis, b minus a, close parenthesis squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>Φ</mtext><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="phi sub B equals, the fraction with numerator mu sub 0, end sub, times I, times open parenthesis, b minus a, close parenthesis, and denominator 2 pi, end fraction, times the natural log of the fraction b over a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mtext>Φ</mtext><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>μ</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>I</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>a</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow></mfrac><mi>ln</mi><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mi>a</mi></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
